intro: Codonanthemum discolor, commonly known as the variable codonanthemum, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, yellow to orange flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
